intro: Erigeron nervosus, commonly known as the threadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, thread-like leaves and daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a taproot system and is often found in disturbed soils. Erigeron nervosus is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
